comments.body:
Why not just:
```scala
  object Scala2 extends KeywordWrapper {
    val keywords: Set[String] = Scala2Keywords
  }
```

and the same with Scala 3?

I did that to [keep the original `Identifier` object](https://github.com/scalameta/metals/pull/2728/files#diff-9e939f6877e27051cb01bda0df080949c8e0b004917760126b62df8c938acdf7R6-R9) for scala2 mtags and avoid changing its occurrences in scala2 pc.

At the same time, I didn't want to introduce an identical `Identifier` object for scala 3 and defined all methods about backticks [in `MtagsEnrichments`](https://github.com/scalameta/metals/pull/2728/files#diff-d2621908f1e39948505b08ae93cfe6174f8496fe899b4a23b9aed5a4e5e7c79fR24-R47)

I may refactor this thing to align backticks methods usage across scala versions
